unnormalised: ## Going Viral, Bhai: Decoding the Latest Social Media Trends
normalised: ## Going Viral, Bhai: Decoding the Latest Social Media Trends

unnormalised: Namaste folks! Ever scrolled through your Insta feed and wondered why THAT video of a cat doing yoga went viral, while your meticulously crafted reel of you making perfect chai got, like, 12 views? Welcome to the wild world of virality!
normalised: Namaste folks! Ever scrolled through your Insta feed and wondered why that video of a cat doing yoga went viral, while your meticulously crafted reel of you making perfect chai got, like, twelve views? Welcome to the wild world of virality!

unnormalised: Understanding what makes content explode on social media is crucial, especially if you're trying to build your brand or even just become the next big influencer from Mumbai. It's not just about luck, although a little bit of "Bhagwan bharose" definitely helps.
normalised: Understanding what makes content explode on social media is crucial, especially if you're trying to build your brand or even just become the next big influencer from Mumbai. It's not just about luck, although a little bit of "Bhagwan bharose" definitely helps.

unnormalised: First off, short-form video content is still king. Think Reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts – the shorter, the better. Nobody has time for a 10-minute lecture on the history of the Taj Mahal (unless, maybe, it's narrated by Ranveer Singh). Keep it snappy, keep it engaging. I saw a hilarious reel yesterday, 10/10/2024, about struggles of finding parking near Chandni Chowk that had over 500k views!

I saw a hilarious reel yesterday, tenth October two thousand and twenty four, about struggles of finding parking near Chandni Chowk that had over five hundred thousand views!

unnormalised: Secondly, authenticity reigns supreme. People are tired of perfectly curated feeds. They want to see real people, real stories, real struggles. That's why creators like Bhuvan Bam connect so well – they're relatable. Show your true colours, even if they're a little faded!

unnormalised: Next up, challenges and trends. Remember the "Jalwa" challenge from a few years back? Or the "Kesariya" dance craze? Jumping on these bandwagons is a quick way to boost visibility. Just make sure it aligns with your brand and doesn't, you know, offend anyone. Remember the fiasco of the poorly executed Diwali ad by Fabindia back in 2021? Learn from their mistakes!

unnormalised: Also, don't underestimate the power of memes. A well-placed meme can speak volumes and resonate with a wider audience. Think about using popular Bollywood dialogues or even referencing classic Indian sitcoms like "Sarabhai vs Sarabhai".
normalised: Also, don't underestimate the power of memes. A well-placed meme can speak volumes and resonate with a wider audience. Think about using popular Bollywood dialogues or even referencing classic Indian sitcoms like "Sarabhai versus Sarabhai".

unnormalised: Finally, remember to engage! Respond to comments, answer questions, and participate in conversations. Building a community is just as important as creating great content. Imagine a virtual chai-pe-charcha at 08:00 hrs every Sunday! Get personal.
normalised: Finally, remember to engage! Respond to comments, answer questions, and participate in conversations. Building a community is just as important as creating great content. Imagine a virtual chai-pe-charcha at zero eight hundred hours every Sunday! Get personal.

unnormalised: Bonus tip: Collaborating with other creators, especially micro-influencers with niche audiences, can be a game-changer. Think a partnership between a fitness influencer from Delhi and a nutritionist from IIT Madras – a win-win!

unnormalised: The social media landscape is constantly evolving, like the traffic on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. Keep experimenting, keep learning, and keep creating. And who knows, maybe your chai-making reel will be the next viral sensation! Good luck and Jai Hind!
